page.title: 16SHOPPING:NORTH NORFOLK:Cont
page.content: But regularity of supply cannot be guaranteed. Bread may be purchased at bakeries which produce freshly-made loaves. Although more expensive this is often preferable to packs of pre-sliced bread avalible in supermarkets. Cakes, pasteries and pudding are often made at home. However, it si easy to buy these in packet mixes from supermarkets for purposes of convenience. Household cleaning equipment can be bought from a supermarket or from chemist stores:once again, choice and value are better in larger stores. Newspapers are available at village stores or can be delivered daily. Sometimes they may not be bought on a regular basis, since television and radio provide news bulletins throughout the day.
